snippet.title: Can Do Not Track starve the Web's Cookie Monster?
snippet.description: ...Last week, the White House announced a new Internet privacy agreement with the companies serving nearly 90 percent of "online behavioral advertisements," theoretically forcing the likes of Google, Yahoo, Microsoft, and AOL to stop monitoring the Web-surfing habits of users who click a "Do Not Track" button on their browsers. While a good step toward broader Web privacy protect...
